column4: Fresenius pulls out of Akorn takeover over data integrity
column5: BERLIN German healthcare group Fresenius SE  said it had decided to pull out of its planned acquisition of Akorn  after it found data integrity breaches at the U.S. generic drug maker.

column4: Fresenius pulls out of Akorn takeover over data integrity
column5: BERLIN  April 22 German healthcare group Fresenius SE said it had decided to pull out of its planned acquisition of Akorn after its own investigation found data integrity breaches at the U.S. generic drug maker.

column4: Amazon to double down on groceries; foray deeper into fresh produce in India
column5: BENGALURU Amazon.com Inc expects groceries and household products to account for over half of its business in India in the next five years  as it moves to broaden offerings in the segment and foray into areas such as fresh produce.

column4: Barron's: General Mills stock may be a bargain after pet food deal
column5: General Mills Inc's  stock could rise to 16 times earnings projections from the current 14 as its acquisition of Blue Buffalo Pet Products Inc starts to create growth  Barron's reported.

column4: HNA cuts stake in Deutsche Bank - filing
column5: BERLIN  April 22 Chinese conglomerate HNA has cut its stake in Deutsche Bank to 7.9 percent  according to a U.S. regulatory filing.

column4: Fresenius Medical cuts 2018 sales target after drug dosage shift
column5: BERLIN German dialysis specialist Fresenius Medical Care  cut its 2018 sales target due to lower than expected doses of calcimimetic drugs at its dialysis service business in the United States.

column4: UPDATE 1-Fresenius Medical cuts 2018 sales target after drug dosage shift
column5: * Now sees 2018 revenue growth of 5-7 pct at constant currency

column4: CORRECTED-U.S. banks push mortgage apps as home lending slows
column5: NEW YORK  April 20 Big U.S. banks are racing to launch websites and mobile apps to make getting a mortgage faster and easier  investments that may have modest near-term payoffs as home lending activity slows.

column4: LATAM Airlines extends flight cancellations due to crew strike
column5: SANTIAGO LAN Express  a subsidiary of the LATAM Airlines group  said on Sunday it was extending until April 28 a plan to cancel or reschedule flights in Chile and other South American destinations due to a strike by cabin crews demanding contract improvements.

column4: Southwest cancels about 40 flights for engine inspections
column5: Southwest Airlines Co  said it canceled about 40 flights on Sunday  or 1 percent of those scheduled  as it inspects engines after last week’s deadly accident in Pennsylvania.
